document.topic_text:
Former New England Patriots player dies at 29 Christopher Buchanan, WXIA 9:04 PM. EST April 24, 2016 FOXBOROUGH, MA - CIRCA 2011: In this handout image provided by the NFL, Ron Brace of the New England Patriots poses for his NFL headshot circa 2011 in Foxborough, Massachusetts. (Photo by NFL via Getty Images) (Photo: Handout, 2011 NFL) Officials have confirmed the death of a former New England Patriots player at only 29-years-old. The New England Patriots released a statement on the death of Ron Brace. The Boston Globe reports that Brace was the second-round pick of the Patriots in 2009 after a standout college career as defensive tackle at Boston College. His former football coach there, Al Washington, responded to the news on Twitter. — Al Washington (@CoachWash56) April 24, 2016
The New England Patriots also responded to the news in a statement on their official website. “It is difficult to believe that someone so young and in the prime of his life is no longer with us,” it read while offering condolences to the family. The team also pointed out that April 25 would be 7 years to the day he was drafted. So far, no organizations are releasing the cause of death. People we've lost in 2016 (© 2016 WXIA)
